summary: "Fahrenheit 451" is a book by Ray Bradbury about a future where books are banned and "firemen" burn them. The story follows Guy Montag, a fireman who starts to question his job and decides to save books instead. Bradbury wrote it during a time of political fear and censorship. The book was inspired by his earlier short stories and real-life experiences. It became very popular but was also censored in some places. "Fahrenheit 451" has been made into movies, plays, and video games, and it won many awards.
title: Fahrenheit 451
